text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>6. Bey Herrn Haag an der Augustinerga√ü sind zu verkauffen:
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Prideaun A. und N. Testam</TITLE>, in einer Connex. mit der V√ölcker-Historie,
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1725</YEAR>.
    <VOLUME>4. 1I. Tom. 1. Vol. 2</VOLUME>
    <PRIZE>Cattenburg</PRIZE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Sapientia Mos. de Vita & Scriptis Mosis contra Deistas</TITLE>.
    <PLACE>Amst.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>.
    <FORMAT>4.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl.</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>8r. 70.</VOLUME>
    <AUTHOR>Interpp. Reineccii</AUTHOR>,
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>.
    <FORMAT>8≤.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Bibl. Hebr.</TITLE>
    <AUTHOR>punctata Leusdenii</AUTHOR>,
    <PLACE>Frf.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1694</YEAR>.
    <FORMAT>12.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Seldenus</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>de Diis Syris</TITLE>.
    <PLACE>Lips.</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1692</YEAR>.
    <FORMAT>8.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Gottschedens</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>critische Dichtkunst</TITLE>,
    <PLACE>Leipzig</PLACE>
    <YEAR>1737</YEAR>.
    <FORMAT>8v≤.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>B∂dickers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Grunds§tze der Deutschen Sprach</TITLE>,
    <PLACE>Berlin</PLACE>,
    <YEAR>1729</YEAR>.
    <FORMAT>8v≤.</FORMAT>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":6,"explanation":"1) Closed the missing </BIBL> after the Amsterdam 1737 item so that each bibliographical unit is properly delimited.
2) Moved the Cattenburg price into its own <PRIZE> element within the first <BIBL> instead of having it follow an orphaned dagger-like character.
3) Escaped the ampersand in the Latin title as & to make the XML well-formed.
4) Ensured every <BIBL> element has a corresponding closing tag and that nesting is not overlapping (the third <BIBL> for “Bibl.” is now top-level, not nested inside the previous one).
5) Treated the garbled characters representing size-marks (8º etc.) and umlauts/umlauted letters as literal text content so that they no longer break XML parsing; they are left as-is but are now in valid text nodes.
6) Added line breaks and indentation only for readability; structure and original textual content (apart from entity-escaping and re-tagging) are preserved."}

parsed.explanation:
1) Closed the missing </BIBL> after the Amsterdam 1737 item so that each bibliographical unit is properly delimited.
2) Moved the Cattenburg price into its own <PRIZE> element within the first <BIBL> instead of having it follow an orphaned dagger-like character.
3) Escaped the ampersand in the Latin title as & to make the XML well-formed.
4) Ensured every <BIBL> element has a corresponding closing tag and that nesting is not overlapping (the third <BIBL> for “Bibl.” is now top-level, not nested inside the previous one).
5) Treated the garbled characters representing size-marks (8º etc.) and umlauts/umlauted letters as literal text content so that they no longer break XML parsing; they are left as-is but are now in valid text nodes.
6) Added line breaks and indentation only for readability; structure and original textual content (apart from entity-escaping and re-tagging) are preserved.
